poem:
The Pre-Budget Ballet  

Ideas leap like dancers, mid-air,  
Turned and twirled in Parliament's glare.  
The Speaker shakes his head—  
A carousel of proposals, quickly fed,  
Spun, then discarded like old shoes.  
Every taxpayer holds their breath,  
Awaiting the orchestras of tax and debt—  
In this curated, yearly dance of chance.
